answers.answer: Hepatitis C isn't form alcohol use, it's a viral infection.  The rest such as congestive heart failure, liver failure, pacreatitis can be from alcohol use and having 3 organs doing poorly portends a poor prognosis but it would be difficult to put a number on it.

question: if a patient has been diagnosed with conjestive heart failure, hepatitis c II, diabetes, gallstones,90% pancreas and liver failure,  all from alcohol abuse, what are the chances of living?  This person is a male, 57 years old.
title: multiple diagnosis
